page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION: ERITH
page.content: The area around Erith falls into four main categories. The first, residential occupies almost two-thirds of the area and reflects a wide variety of housing; the second, industrial, is mainly to the north, along the river and giving work; the third, the River Thames to the north east, provides further jobs and leisure opportunities; and finally, the open ground of the Erith Marshes to the north and Lesnes Park to the west. These combine to give the area its own particular character, which is enhanced by the multi-cultural nature of its population. Within it are people from all parts of Europe and Asia, whose cultural heritage flavours this east of London region. And so the following pages contain many of our impressions of life in Erith in 1985. Dip in and taste them.
